messages: 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:05): arun around?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:14): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: arun is hardly ever around on IRC
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:15): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: if you want to real-time talk with him, maybe e-mail him first and get his contact info
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:15): maybe he prefers some other chat mechanism (skype or whatever)
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:22): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: nevermind, it's not a real hurry
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:22): but the Unite thing is the reason for us wanting a traditional file I/O spec
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:24): (and apologies if I've been unrelenting on certain security issues -- I just don't want the web security model to infest the server side)

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:29): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: I don't think anybody with an open mind would expect you to apologize for that. and you don't otherwise owe any apologies to those who've been trotting out the narrow-minded "it's not the Web" rhetoric
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:31): I don't think apologies are needed, the security issues are a cause of concern whether unite is there or not
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:32): if the "it's not the Web" thing were phrased instead as, "it's not the browser security model", then the right response is, Yeah, well, no shit, Sherlock.
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:32): besides, since when do we apologise around here?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:32): saying "it's not the Web" is a good way to offer an invitation to a fistfight
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:32): well that's the point isn't it?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:33): 56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e: are you calling me a sissy?

56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:33): that being said, I still think that we ought to stick to the browser security model as much as possible ‚Äî if things become too different we lose the advantage of known technology
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:33): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: do I need to call you that? I thought it was rather obvious
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:34): is it my purse?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:34): because it's not a purse
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:34): more like the haircut
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:34): it's a "men's bag"
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:34): it's a manpouch!
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:34): I have one too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:36): I saw this dude today that instead of a man bag he was carrying this sort of miniature aluminum attache
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:36): which actually made him look even more like a little miss prissy
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:37): because it's like, dude, if you're going to carry an attache, carry a real one
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:37): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: my point is that I've been unrelenting, but unwilling to explain why
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:38): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: that's OK, nobody understands you when you explain stuff anyway
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:38): and being unrelenting is the only way to survive around here
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:39): 56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e: re serverjs: I'm not really all that sure serverjs is the right thing
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:39): because the other bastards will eat you alive if you ever un-unrelent
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (13:39): at least not after having looked at a partial implementation like jack.js

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:40): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: anyway, congrats on Unite -- seriously nice piece of work. I'm looking forward to seeing what kinds of things folks end up doing with it.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:43): has to go.. will barge back in again later on my train ride back home
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:45): 85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2: I don't know, I thought I should make a feature request before trying it
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:45): I was just thinking that it's a potentially nice set of APIs to produce web services
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:45): nice work, I agree
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (13:45): (I'm running it now)
